page.title: 02 Irthlingborough Northants.
page.content: Irthlingborough is a small town with a population of about 5,500.It is on the A6,the main road from London to Carlisle and on the banks of the River Nene,in East Northamptonshire.People settled here in Roman and Viking times and it is mentioned in the original Domesday Book as part of the Huxloe Hundreds under the name of Erdiburne. In the 12th century it was known as Urtlingbure, in the 13th century Yrlingbure, in the 14th century Hertillingborogh, in the 15th century Itchingborowe, it was finally standardised as Irthlingborough in the 19th century. In 1801 ,when the census was started, the population was 811.since that time there has been a steady increase, influenced by local industries.
